description: From Hebrew צַדִּיק‎ (tsadík, “righteous person”). Many pronunciations have come under the influence of Yiddish צדיק‎ (tsadek).

entries.meaning: (Judaism) A very righteous person, especially a Hassidic spiritual leader.
examples: For in dreams one thinks with the eyes and the ears; speech has no nouns, just verbs; only in dreams is every person a zaddik, never a murderer….
